summary:
ok but what if TJ and Kira used to be childhood friends and she's the only one who knows he's gay?
but when they split to go to...
body:
ok but what if TJ and Kira used to be childhood friends and she’s the only one who knows he’s gay?

but when they split to go to different schools, TJ befriended Reed and Lester and changed??

and now that Kira is back, they made up and are friends again???

so when Cyrus says no to the S&P costumes he turns to her because she’s the only friend he has left after those idiots abandoned him????

also it might be the reason why they’re both so good at basketball?????

blog.name: disneymack
blog.title: andi mack trash
blog.description:
sadie. 23. she/they. lesbian. here to talk about tv & give advice. hoodie enthusiast. fandom mother.

main blog & twitter: sadieannerue instagram: dailymackcast, andimackpapercraneproject

summary: PLEASE ANSWER!!  So the text had originally said TJ and not my dad?!?! I thought people hade like photoshopped TJ’s name into...
question: PLEASE ANSWER!!  So the text had originally said TJ and not my dad?!?! I thought people hade like photoshopped TJ’s name into the text, but it seems that the people over the texting game change it?! Omg whyyy???? Why had the fact tj and Cyrus hang out more?? Is that a crime???
answer:
No idea what you’re talking about. The texts always said that he was with his dad. Any images floating around that say TJ instead are fake. 

Also feel free to check out this post in which I explain why they wouldn’t have “forced” them to make such a change, and how the texts are still foreshadowing Tyrus: https://disneymack.tumblr.com/post/183005430586/do-you-also-get-the-feeling-that-they-forced-cyrus

summary: You know what’s weird I just remembered he gave away his skateboard to Buffy in Cookie Monster and yet this was at a time he...
question: You know what’s weird I just remembered he gave away his skateboard to Buffy in Cookie Monster and yet this was at a time he knew about his family’s financial issues, unless Jonah is lying I definitely think the way the writers lined up Jonah’s homeless storyline was very poorly handled.
answer:
Actually @tjswings talked about this in a post yesterday that I really liked. I bookmarked it because I planned on adding my thoughts today, but I guess I’ll just do that here since you’ve given me an opportunity. Here’s the link to that post though: http://tjswings.tumblr.com/post/183019524108/thoughtsdiscourse-on-the-new-jonah-plot-a-lot-of 

So first of all, I agree with both of you (anon and Sarah) in that this storyline has been poorly executed. It really goes to show that even though Jonah has been a member of the main cast since the first episode, they really never got the hang of treating him as such. I’ve talked about this before - that in the first season it was a stylistic choice because we were seeing his character from the point of view of the GHC, and how since then we have started to see him as a more well-rounded human character. And I really expected for season 3 to finally do a good job at helping us see him as clearly as we see the other three main kids - but this is a pretty huge step back in that progress. 

I don’t necessarily think the problem is what they did do (like the skateboard thing, which I will touch on more in a bit), but there is definitely a problem what they didn’t do. It wouldn’t have been hard to show signs of this storyline somewhere between episodes 2 and 12. They had ten full episodes where they could have snuck in subtle hints that we only would have noticed in hindsight. They could have made it clear that he was hungrier than usual, especially at the moon festival or the shiva. They could have shown him get uncomfortable at the mention of his father during I Got Your Number. They could have shown him be a little uncomfortable when it came to going to The Color Factory, or renting the canoes. They could have tied it into his panic attack in a way that gave the audience an understanding of what was happening. They could have had him casually mention that he’s broke, like Amber did when she stayed the night at Andi’s. Or at the very least they could have had him say something in the texts.

I know they are going to explore it further, and I’m really excited to see that, and I think the new episode was still really well done - but it feels like they missed an opportunity to make it better. As much as people like to claim that they never touch on Cyrus’ sexuality storyline, we were getting subtle hints towards that from the very beginning of the series. Cyrus fangirling over Jonah, his insecurity about being called girly, the look on his face when Iris said that he’s uncomplicated, his reminder to Andi that kisses can mean a lot of things and he knows because of his kiss with Iris… there were subtle hints sprinkled in between the big moments. But unfortunately, with Jonah’s storylines, we haven’t gotten that as much. With both the anxiety storyline, and now his family’s financial troubles, they’ve fallen flat and it’s just a shame. I still LOVE the storylines and I think the writers are incredible, I just think there was more to do that would have made these stories have a heavier impact. And that’s why I’m still holding out hope that they will be tied together in a really productive way before the end of the season - but I guess we’ll just have to see. 

Now - writing flaws aside - back to your original point: The skateboard. I’m not going to actually try to defend the writers in this situation because like I said, it is messy and inconsistent. However, in terms of what is happening in-universe, I don’t think that the skateboard thing is actually all that unrealistic. There are a lot of misconceptions around what it means to be poor, and one of the most common ones is that people think that poor people either can’t have or don’t deserve nice things. I’ve mentioned on here before, I am poor and I grew up pretty poor… but I still found ways to make money and do the things I wanted to do. I still went to dozens of concerts when I was in high school. I went to theme parks with friends. I went to the movies or out to eat sometimes. I bought junk that I wanted. I almost always had a computer. Part of this was because my grandma would always find a way to get us the things we needed or wanted, even if it meant selling her jewelry from when she was younger or something like that. Eventually we became poor enough to where that was no longer an option, but I still found money to do things. I would sell my belongings on ebay. I would save up money from holidays and birthdays. I would have yard sales. I used to skip lunch and save up my lunch money to buy concert tickets. And because I was a teenager, I wasn’t burdened with the responsibility of my family’s financial struggles. Sure, they couldn’t afford to give me any extra money - but they never expected me to give them my money either. So that meant that when I did have extra money, it could go towards fun things like going out to eat or concert tickets or in Jonah’s case - a skateboard. And it’s a shame that we won’t see any sort of explanation for that on screen, because it’s important to teach people that poverty looks different on different people. Just because your friend has nice things, doesn’t mean they aren’t also poor. And just because your friend is poor, doesn’t mean they don’t deserve nice things. It’s actually incredibly important for poor people to have these nice things, because being poor can be hard and sometimes we need a fucking break and to just be allowed to do something that makes us happy. 

Even the idea of him giving his old skateboard to Buffy doesn’t go against the poor thing to me. It was him being nice, like he always is, and he also was able to give himself a rational excuse to spend money on a new one - which is something I do constantly. I have to make excuses for myself to spend money so I don’t feel guilty afterward. And while selling it to Buffy would have certainly made more sense if they had wanted to tie it into this storyline, it is what it is. Jonah’s the type of guy who would give you the shirt off his back. It actually reminds me of this story I’ve always been told about how my grandma, who also grew up poor, one time traded shoes with a girl she went to school with and she got in trouble when she got home because they had to save up for those shoes in the first place. Obviously not exactly the same but yeah. Just a note of what it personally reminds me of.

But overall - I agree with the fact that these stories are falling short, and it’s a real shame because I do respect the writers of this show a lot. It feels weird that we never got to see Amber’s storyline like this fully play out, and that they circled back around with Jonah, and then used it to push together some separate drama involving both of them. There’s still a lot of potential for both characters and their storylines over the last 9 episode so I’m holding out hope that it will be done well, but I totally understand the frustrations with the way they chose to reveal this issue. 

Jonah is a main character, and Amber has been on the series since the first episode - yet they haven’t done either of them justice. And like I said, I’m holding out hope that since they managed to tie their two storylines together, no matter how messy the execution, that it means they’re actually gong to address them in a satisfying way but at this point, there’s no telling what will happen next. It’s just wild to me that TJ has had such satisfying and linear character development over the course of 14 episodes while Jonah and Amber have been put on the back burner. But overall, I’m not one to criticize a storyline before I see it completed so I’m not ~angry~ about what’s happening right now by any means. I just wanna see where it goes, and then I’ll form a more cohesive opinion.

And while selling it to Buffy would have certainly made more sense if they had wanted to tie it into this storyline, it is what it is. Jonah’s the type of guy who would give you the shirt off his back. It actually reminds me of this story I’ve always been told about how my grandma, who also grew up poor, one time traded shoes with a girl she went to school with and she got in trouble when she got home because they had to save up for those shoes in the first place. Obviously not exactly the same but yeah. Just a note of what it personally reminds me of.

But overall - I agree with the fact that these stories are falling short, and it’s a real shame because I do respect the writers of this show a lot. It feels weird that we never got to see Amber’s storyline like this fully play out, and that they circled back around with Jonah, and then used it to push together some separate drama involving both of them. There’s still a lot of potential for both characters and their storylines over the last 9 episode so I’m holding out hope that it will be done well, but I totally understand the frustrations with the way they chose to reveal this issue. 

Jonah is a main character, and Amber has been on the series since the first episode - yet they haven’t done either of them justice. And like I said, I’m holding out hope that since they managed to tie their two storylines together, no matter how messy the execution, that it means they’re actually gong to address them in a satisfying way but at this point, there’s no telling what will happen next. It’s just wild to me that TJ has had such satisfying and linear character development over the course of 14 episodes while Jonah and Amber have been put on the back burner. But overall, I’m not one to criticize a storyline before I see it completed so I’m not ~angry~ about what’s happening right now by any means. I just wanna see where it goes, and then I’ll form a more cohesive opinion.
trail.content:
Actually @tjswings talked about this in a post yesterday that I really liked. I bookmarked it because I planned on adding my thoughts today, but I guess I’ll just do that here since you’ve given me an opportunity. Here’s the link to that post though: http://tjswings.tumblr.com/post/183019524108/thoughtsdiscourse-on-the-new-jonah-plot-a-lot-of 

So first of all, I agree with both of you (anon and Sarah) in that this storyline has been poorly executed. It really goes to show that even though Jonah has been a member of the main cast since the first episode, they really never got the hang of treating him as such. I’ve talked about this before - that in the first season it was a stylistic choice because we were seeing his character from the point of view of the GHC, and how since then we have started to see him as a more well-rounded human character. And I really expected for season 3 to finally do a good job at helping us see him as clearly as we see the other three main kids - but this is a pretty huge step back in that progress. 

I don’t necessarily think the problem is what they did do (like the skateboard thing, which I will touch on more in a bit), but there is definitely a problem what they didn’t do. It wouldn’t have been hard to show signs of this storyline somewhere between episodes 2 and 12. They had ten full episodes where they could have snuck in subtle hints that we only would have noticed in hindsight. They could have made it clear that he was hungrier than usual, especially at the moon festival or the shiva. They could have shown him get uncomfortable at the mention of his father during I Got Your Number. They could have shown him be a little uncomfortable when it came to going to The Color Factory, or renting the canoes. They could have tied it into his panic attack in a way that gave the audience an understanding of what was happening. They could have had him casually mention that he’s broke, like Amber did when she stayed the night at Andi’s. Or at the very least they could have had him say something in the texts.

I know they are going to explore it further, and I’m really excited to see that, and I think the new episode was still really well done - but it feels like they missed an opportunity to make it better. As much as people like to claim that they never touch on Cyrus’ sexuality storyline, we were getting subtle hints towards that from the very beginning of the series. Cyrus fangirling over Jonah, his insecurity about being called girly, the look on his face when Iris said that he’s uncomplicated, his reminder to Andi that kisses can mean a lot of things and he knows because of his kiss with Iris… there were subtle hints sprinkled in between the big moments. But unfortunately, with Jonah’s storylines, we haven’t gotten that as much. With both the anxiety storyline, and now his family’s financial troubles, they’ve fallen flat and it’s just a shame. I still LOVE the storylines and I think the writers are incredible, I just think there was more to do that would have made these stories have a heavier impact. And that’s why I’m still holding out hope that they will be tied together in a really productive way before the end of the season - but I guess we’ll just have to see. 

Now - writing flaws aside - back to your original point: The skateboard. I’m not going to actually try to defend the writers in this situation because like I said, it is messy and inconsistent. However, in terms of what is happening in-universe, I don’t think that the skateboard thing is actually all that unrealistic. There are a lot of misconceptions around what it means to be poor, and one of the most common ones is that people think that poor people either can’t have or don’t deserve nice things. I’ve mentioned on here before, I am poor and I grew up pretty poor… but I still found ways to make money and do the things I wanted to do. I still went to dozens of concerts when I was in high school. I went to theme parks with friends. I went to the movies or out to eat sometimes. I bought junk that I wanted. I almost always had a computer. Part of this was because my grandma would always find a way to get us the things we needed or wanted, even if it meant selling her jewelry from when she was younger or something like that. Eventually we became poor enough to where that was no longer an option, but I still found money to do things. I would sell my belongings on ebay. I would save up money from holidays and birthdays. I would have yard sales. I used to skip lunch and save up my lunch money to buy concert tickets. And because I was a teenager, I wasn’t burdened with the responsibility of my family’s financial struggles. Sure, they couldn’t afford to give me any extra money - but they never expected me to give them my money either. So that meant that when I did have extra money, it could go towards fun things like going out to eat or concert tickets or in Jonah’s case - a skateboard. And it’s a shame that we won’t see any sort of explanation for that on screen, because it’s important to teach people that poverty looks different on different people. Just because your friend has nice things, doesn’t mean they aren’t also poor. And just because your friend is poor, doesn’t mean they don’t deserve nice things. It’s actually incredibly important for poor people to have these nice things, because being poor can be hard and sometimes we need a fucking break and to just be allowed to do something that makes us happy. 

Even the idea of him giving his old skateboard to Buffy doesn’t go against the poor thing to me. It was him being nice, like he always is, and he also was able to give himself a rational excuse to spend money on a new one - which is something I do constantly. I have to make excuses for myself to spend money so I don’t feel guilty afterward. And while selling it to Buffy would have certainly made more sense if they had wanted to tie it into this storyline, it is what it is. Jonah’s the type of guy who would give you the shirt off his back. It actually reminds me of this story I’ve always been told about how my grandma, who also grew up poor, one time traded shoes with a girl she went to school with and she got in trouble when she got home because they had to save up for those shoes in the first place. Obviously not exactly the same but yeah. Just a note of what it personally reminds me of.

But overall - I agree with the fact that these stories are falling short, and it’s a real shame because I do respect the writers of this show a lot. It feels weird that we never got to see Amber’s storyline like this fully play out, and that they circled back around with Jonah, and then used it to push together some separate drama involving both of them. There’s still a lot of potential for both characters and their storylines over the last 9 episode so I’m holding out hope that it will be done well, but I totally understand the frustrations with the way they chose to reveal this issue. 

Jonah is a main character, and Amber has been on the series since the first episode - yet they haven’t done either of them justice. And like I said, I’m holding out hope that since they managed to tie their two storylines together, no matter how messy the execution, that it means they’re actually gong to address them in a satisfying way but at this point, there’s no telling what will happen next. It’s just wild to me that TJ has had such satisfying and linear character development over the course of 14 episodes while Jonah and Amber have been put on the back burner. But overall, I’m not one to criticize a storyline before I see it completed so I’m not ~angry~ about what’s happening right now by any means. I just wanna see where it goes, and then I’ll form a more cohesive opinion.

Here’s the link to that post though: http://tjswings.tumblr.com/post/183019524108/thoughtsdiscourse-on-the-new-jonah-plot-a-lot-of 

So first of all, I agree with both of you (anon and Sarah) in that this storyline has been poorly executed. It really goes to show that even though Jonah has been a member of the main cast since the first episode, they really never got the hang of treating him as such. I’ve talked about this before - that in the first season it was a stylistic choice because we were seeing his character from the point of view of the GHC, and how since then we have started to see him as a more well-rounded human character. summary:
Costume day
Okay so everyone has been freaking out about this picture because TJ and Kira are matching but I don’t think we have...
body:
Costume day

Okay so everyone has been freaking out about this picture because TJ and Kira are matching but I don’t think we have to worry. So since Kira likes basketball she might have joined the boys team after she left the girls. So that would mean that TJ and Kira are on the same team. So here’s what I’m thinking:

Andi is running around trying to make Mount Rushmore, then TJ and Cyrus talk about there joint/couple costume, Cyrus ask Buffy if Andi will be mad while keeping TJ a secret and Buffy says that Andi will be mad. So Cyrus tells TJ and they do separate costumes. Now they both already have the salt and pepper costumes, they’re just not gonna wear them. The school for the basketball team has t-shirts for people who want to participate in costume day but have no costumes. So that automatically makes TJ and Kira match.

Andi finds out that Cyrus wants to match with TJ and she lets him, Cyrus then finds TJ so they both change into there matching costumes and take a picture together for (probably spirit week.)

There! Drama avoided!

summary:
Cyrus: Did you tell your dad that we're a couple?
TJ: Of course I did.
Cyrus: Well, that's explains it. 
TJ: Explains what?...
body:
Cyrus: Did you tell your dad that we’re a couple?

TJ: Of course I did.

Cyrus: Well, that’s explains it.

TJ: Explains what?

Cyrus: Why he’s drinking out of a mug with the words “#1 Tyrus Shipper” printed on it.

TJ, whipping his head towards his dad: He’s WHAT??

TJ: Dad, what did I say about using my mugs?!

Mr. Kippen: Oh c'mon, these are iconic! Besides, your mom is using my favourite “I’m a Smiiten Kippen” one and this one here is the next best thing!

TJ: Okay, first off, quit saying “iconic”! It’s weird! Second, stop calling my–emphasis on MY–mugs your favourites! They’re mine, remember?? Now can you please put them back with the others?

Cyrus: The others …?

summary:
Photo Credit: DisneyChannelCentral
I’m a couple days late on this, but I still wanted to make this. I’m changing this to recap...
body:
Andi Mack 3x13 Promo Recap

Photo Credit: DisneyChannelCentral

I’m a couple days late on this, but I still wanted to make this. I’m changing this to recap instead of analysis since that’s what I basically do in these.

Plot A: Costume Day

Before I say anything else, let’s just acknowledge the evolution of Metcalf. The same guy who announced Costume Day was the same guy who had the strictest dress code rules ever. That is progress!

As for the plot itself, here’s what we know. Andi gets a notification about the event, to which she later states their plan to go as Mount Rushmore. This is what I’m calling the setup storyline because it trails into what I believe to be three more.

Plot B: Potential Betrayal #1

As we know, Tall Lover Boy comes up to Less Tall Lover Boy and invites him as his partner for CD. Based on the shoulder bumping, a lot of people knew Cyrus would be split on his friend and crush. Not even three seconds later, this line comes up.

“Do you think Andi will still be my friend if I bail on Mount Rushmore?”

Plot C: Potential Betrayal #2

Here’s what I’m predicting over this one scene. Marty is going to come up to Buffy asking to partner with him for Costume Day.

To make it worse, this will be after Buffy gives Cyrus a lecture on not bailing. Just a prediction, though.

Plot D: Bail Mail

Andi, trying to finding a sheet for MR, instead locates the unmailed wedding invitations that Bex refused to send.


We’re going to get a scene of Bex revealing her doubt on the wedding, and that causes the scene of Andi walking out of the house.

blog.description: | she/her | lgbtq+ | andi mack means the world to me

body:
Tyrus Songs

He Could Be the One- Hannah Montana

The Only Exception- Paramore

Lemon Boy- Cavetown duh

No One Else- Natasha, Pierre, and the Great Comet of 1812

When I Look at You- Miley Cyrus

Obvious- Dear Evan Hansen (it’s a cut song)

blog.name: andiwhack
blog.title: k*ra hatemail
blog.description: she/her-bi-basically an andi mack blog

summary: wait what are we gonna do if tyrus is endgame
body:
wait what are we gonna do if tyrus is endgame

ive always been rooting for it but i dont know if im programmed that far, how should we go about this
